Participants will engage in service work throughout New York City, reflect on their experiences, explore issues of ethical leadership development, and connect with ongoing civic engagement opportunities at NYU.                               Participants and Peer Mentors gather for daily reflection sessions                                 Building community through service                               OutReach participants working with a local non-profit organization           Are you an incoming first-year or transfer student interested in service, leadership, and social justice? Are you excited about getting involved at NYU and looking forward to making a difference in New York City? Make a commitment to serve the community around you by applying to Project OutReach!    Project OutReach brings together service-minded first-year and transfer students for leadership training, service, and reflection in a week-long, intensive program prior to NYU's Welcome Week . Participants will work with community partner agencies throughout the city each day, learning about a variety of social issues and gathering socially responsible leadership skills.   Project OutReach is limited to 100 participants, and the selection process is highly competitive.              2015 Application   The 2015 Project OutReach Application will be available as of Friday May 1, 2015. The deadline to apply is Monday, June 15, at 11:45PM.   Apply to Project OutReach 2015        Key Dates   Project OutReach 2015 will run from Monday, August 24 through Friday, August 28 . The application deadline is June 15, 2015 at 11:45 PM EST . Applicants will be notified of selection to the program by Monday, June 29th. Participants must arrive on campus, move in to their residence halls, and be ready to begin Project OutReach activities by Monday, August 24th at 2:00 PM.   Students who will be living on campus for the 2015-2016 academic year will gain access to NYU housing prior to the start of Project OutReach. OutReach is a program that requires a full commitment from participants, with activities scheduled each day from the early morning through evening hours. Participants will be unable to hold external commitments, including jobs or external social engagements, during that week.         Program Offerings and Schedule   Participants in Project OutReach will be divided into small groups and will spend each day volunteering with a local community organization throughout New York City's five boroughs. Groups will work on a diversity of projects throughout the week: from rebuilding homes damaged during Hurricane Sandy in Staten Island, to sorting donations at The Food Bank in the Bronx, to working with a tutoring program in Brooklyn. On Friday, the entire team will work together on a large scale project.   Throughout the week there will also be a wide range of educational programs, including social justice trainings, films, guest speakers, and a mini-conference aimed at connecting participants with service initiatives at NYU and beyond.   Participation Fee   Project OutReach requires a non-refundable fee of $100, paid to NYU in full by Friday, July 10th. This fee goes towards supporting program expenses including daily meals, a weekly unlimited MetroCard for travel during the program, service site supplies, and t-shirts. More information about how to make this payment will be provided to accepted participants.   The cost of OutReach should not prohibit anyone from applying to the program. A limited number of scholarships are available to participants each year. To apply for financial assistance, please complete a Project OutReach Scholarship form, and submit it along with your program application by June 15.                                                                   @OutReachNYU                                               fb.com/OutReachNYU                                If you have any questions about the Project OutReach program, please feel free to call the Center for Student Activities, Leadership, and Service at 212-998-4700 , or reach out via e-mail project.outreach@nyu.edu . Here you will find useful information about the University's construction projects, including project descriptions, announcements, and answers to frequently asked questions. For details click on pins in the interactive map or visit current projects »            Spotlight on Current Projects                      Construction on the Superblocks                     Academic Space Renovations 383 Lafayette                     Renovations at Hayden Hall 33 Wash Sq West                     NYU College of Nursing 433 First Avenue              Stay Connected            General Inquiries     During normal business hours, (Monday through Friday, 9:00 am - 5:00 pm), contact the NYU Office of Government and Community Affairs , the University's primary liaison to the community, at community.affairs@nyu.edu or 212.998.2400.   Outside of normal business hours, contact the NYU Office of Facilities & Construction Management at contactcsc@nyu.edu or 212.998.1001.              For questions regarding projects at the NYU Langone Medical Center and NYU School of Medicine , contact the Langone Medical Center's Real Estate Development Office .            Sign Up for Updates       Want to receive updates about NYU construction projects in your neighborhood? Fill out our online form to receive word if a construction project happens nearby. Join the list »                           Announcements              383 Lafayette Street     April 10, 2014  Interior work continues. The permanent lane closure is scheduled for the week of April 13th. Read more »              726 Broadway     April 10, 2015  Interior construction continues. The sidewalk fence instllation and Con Edision work commences the week of April 13th. Read more »            33 Washington Sq W, Hayden Hall   March 13, 2015  Contractors are scheduled to work on Saturday, March 14. Work hours are scheduled from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm. Read more »            Con Edison Vault on Greene Street     February 6, 2015  Con Edison is scheduled to begin work on their vault on Greene Street between Washington Place and West 4th Street on Monday, February 9, 2015. Weather permitting, the work is scheduled to occur over three weeks. The work will include repairs to the vault, the installation of reinforced steel, and a concrete pour.   Con Edison’s work hours will be Monday to Friday, 7:00 am to 3:00 pm.            4 Washington Place, Meyer   January 22, 2015  A packer truck will be staged on Mercer for debris removal Monday - Friday from 7:00 pm - 9:00 pm, starting on January 22 through January 31. Read more »            For previous updates, explore individual project pages.
